item.title: Absolum Preview: Upcoming Beat em Up Continues to Impress
item.description:
Guard Crush Games' Absolum taps into the same things that the best action roguelikes do by delivering what fans of the genre love most — visceral, hard-hitting combat, worthwhile progression, and an eye-catching art style that makes the whole thing look good while doing it. As Absolum inches toward its eventual release, Guard Crush and publisher Dotemu have been steadily revealing more of the game, introducing new classes, showing off more of its progression systems, and generally peeling back the layers to expose Absolum as being one of the year's most promising roguelikes. But this latest hands-on preview is perhaps the best approximation of the full product we've gotten yet.

For its latest playable slice, Absolum is pulling back the curtain to reveal the fourth and final playable character from its assortment of RPG-archetype heroes, and it seems like Guard Crush may have saved the best for last. We've previously had the chance to go hands-on with the warrior Galandra, the brawler Karl, and the rogue Cider. Now with newcomer Brome rounding things out as the group's de facto mage, the full picture of what to expect from Absolum is beginning to take shape, and it's cementing itself as one of the year's most exciting new games, roguelike or otherwise.

Absolum's Brome May Be One of the Game's Best Characters

The introduction of Brome serves as a reminder that Absolum is more than just a great roguelike beat 'em up, placing just as much emphasis on its story as its gameplay in a way that will appeal to fans of games like Hades . In Absolum 's fantasy realm of Talamh, Brom's race is the main target of prejudice and subjugation under antagonist Azra as natural practitioners of magic. So, while some of the other heroes' motivations for rising against Azra feel more personal, Brome's choice to fight against one of Talamh's great injustices comes off as more selfless. But of course, none of that would really matter if he weren't also incredibly fun to play, which he most certainly is.

Unlike the other playable heroes in Absolum , Brome doesn't walk or run across the map; he surfs atop his wizard staff as if it were a hoverboard. That sense of speed carries over into how he handles in combat, able to swiftly execute aerial juggles and other attacks that keep enemies occupied and at a distance to compensate for his weaker defense. As a mage, Brome also has access to a wide variety of Arcana ( Absolum 's version of magic abilities) that quickly recharge to be readily and repeatedly used in battle. Thanks to his versatility and potency in the game's already excellent combat, Brome feels like an immediate standout and a strong contender for being a mainstay in co-op squads.

Between its Gameplay and Presentation, Absolum Already Feels Ready for Launch

In addition to introducing Brome as the game's fourth and final character, the latest playable demo for Absolum seems to have the game's progression systems and art assets ironed out in such a way that it feels like the game is more than ready for its recently confirmed October 9 launch. Visual effects and backgrounds that were formerly placeholder assets have now been replaced with their permanent counterparts, underscoring the absolutely gorgeous visual style that Absolum has settled on courtesy of co-developer (and animation studio) Supamonks. But most impressive is how strong Absolum 's progression feels now, with the general meta-progression curve feeling a lot more laid out and clear ahead of release.

Guard Crush Games' work on the modern beat 'em up masterpiece Streets of Rage 4 positioned them as a studio to watch moving forward, and that its follow-up is yet another beat 'em up is a great sign for the future of the genre. Absolum is a lot more than just another beat 'em up, though, blending elements of role-playing games and action roguelikes to ultimately land as a cross between Hades and the Sega Saturn classic Guardian Heroes . Those are some big shoes to fill, but Absolum continues to impress and prove that it's earned the praise and flattering comparisons.

item.title: Stardew Valley Voice Acting Mod Reveals Full Cast
item.description:
The creator of an upcoming Stardew Valley voice acting mod has recently divulged the cast members involved in the project. This mod intends to give full voice acting to romanceable characters in Stardew Valley , and is using the help of 12 actors to achieve this goal.

Originally released in 2016, Stardew Valley is one of the most popular games ever created. Not only did Stardew Valley sold over 41 million copies by December 2024, but the title has maintained a passionate community, with some gamers putting hundreds or thousands of hours into the title. This success has led to the appearance of a growing number of Stardew Valley modding projects.

Cast of Stardew Valley's Voice Acting Mod

  • Abigail: Diana Jurand
  • Alex: Eamon Kinsman
  • Elliot: Emmanuel Menjivar
  • Emily: Ariel Michelle
  • Haley: Kemi Heydee Stanton
  • Harvey: GM Hakim
  • Leah: Aiden Dawn
  • Maru: Nia Celeste
  • Penny: Heidi Tabing
  • Sam: Jacob Hopkins
  • Sebastian: David Meyers
  • Shane: Jonathan David Bullock

Now, creator Shannon Hobby has unveiled the official cast for the upcoming “Stardew Voices: A Voice Over Mod,” which still does not have a confirmed release date, but is said to release during the Fall. The new mod adds voice acting to all 12 romanceable characters in Stardew Valley , potentially increasing the player’s immersion. The full cast includes Diana Jurand (Abigail), Eamon Kinsman (Alex), Emmanuel Menjivar (Elliot), Ariel Michelle (Emily), Kemi Heydee Stanton (Haley), GM Hakim (Harvey), Aiden Dawn (Leah), Nia Celeste (Maru), Heidi Tabing (Penny), Jacob Hopkins (Sam), David Meyers (Sebastian), and Jonathan David Bullock (Shane). Unfortunately, other characters will not get voice-overs with the mod, but this is still a very exciting project regardless, considering that all voice acting will be made without using technologies that could have cut some corners, such as AI.

“Stardew Voices: a Voice Over Mod” is just the latest of a few ambitious Stardew Valley mods to appear recently. A recent Baldur’s Gate 3 -themed mod for Stardew Valley , for example, added over 20 characters, six new locations, shops, items, and more to the popular farming sim. The mod greatly changes the game by adding Baldur’s Village to the north of Pelican Valley, and includes popular characters such as Karlach, Shadowheart, Gale, Astarion, and others. This project became even more well-known when Wizards of the Coast took it down, apologizing for the “mistake” later.

Many gamers who have played Stardew Valley for a few years have tried mods at least once. Stardew Valley has some excellent mods, allowing gamers to change the outfits of characters, make fish visible in the water, add fresh content, and much more. Hopefully, the upcoming “Stardew Voices: A Voice Over Mod” will be just as good as these, helping gamers to connect even more with the characters of Pelican Town.

item.title: Ex-Gears of War and Diablo Leader Joins 2K to Become Head of BioShock Franchise
item.description:
Former Gears of War and Diablo head, Rod Fergusson, has joined 2K's Cloud Chamber to oversee the BioShock franchise. This comes just weeks after Fergusson parted ways with Blizzard Entertainment, where he helped lead the Diablo franchise through the 2023 launch of Diablo 4 and its subsequent seasons. Prior to his time at Blizzard, Fergusson had a long and storied history with the Gears of War franchise , both at Epic Games and later, The Coalition. He's now found a new home with BioShock .

BioShock fans have been waiting well over a decade for the next entry in the philosophical first-person shooter franchise that was once considered the crown jewel of the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 generation. There have been a lot of changes since the 2013 release of BioShock Infinite . The series developer Irrational Games was turned into the much smaller Ghost Story Games, while the keys to the franchise were later given to an all-new studio, Cloud Chamber, created in 2019 and led by former Firaxis Games producer Kelley Gilmore. After many years of silence from Cloud Chamber, recent reports suggest major shifts have happened within the studio, including Gilmore's departure, leading to massive setbacks regarding BioShock 4 .

Rod Fergusson Has Joined 2K to Lead the BioShock Franchise

Just a few weeks after this disappointing BioShock 4 news broke, it seems Cloud Chamber has a new leader. Rod Fergusson took to Twitter to announce that he's joined 2K and is stepping into Cloud Chamber as the new "Head of BioShock." Fergusson's arrival does come with some bad news, though, as it's been confirmed that an unknown number of Cloud Chamber staff members have been laid off as part of the studio's shake-ups. Like his Diablo role, it doesn't seem like he'll be directing games himself, but rather managing everything the franchise has in development, including "franchise extensions" like the BioShock Netflix movie, as mentioned in his tweet.

Rod Fergusson is no stranger to the BioShock series, as he joined Irrational Games back in 2012 to oversee BioShock Infinite 's final months of development, which up to that point had reportedly been quite rocky. His short stint at Irrational bringing BioShock Infinite to the finish line helped give him the reputation of a "closer," someone who comes in to set a troubled project on the right path toward release. With this in mind, it could be possible that BioShock 4 might also be close to its finish line, with Rod "The Closer" Fergusson just now coming in. However, if things had gone smoothly enough to near a release, these major shake-ups and layoffs at Cloud Chamber likely wouldn't have happened.

While it's disappointing to hear about even more industry layoffs, there's still some excitement about an industry veteran like Rod Fergusson coming in to lead the BioShock franchise. Fans of BioShock should also keep an eye on Judas , a zany FPS from the original BioShock creator, Ken Levine, which is in development at the aforementioned Ghost Story Games. Judas showed off a look at its gameplay in early 2024, but nothing has been heard of it since. Hopefully, both Judas and BioShock 4 are now on the right track.

item.title: This Disney Dreamlight Valley Money-Making Strategy is Still Virtually Unbeatable for Me, 600+ Hours In
item.description:
I've been playing Disney Dreamlight Valley since the day it first launched in Early Access, and there's one thing I've learned in my 600+ hours: you can never have enough Star Coins. Disney Dreamlight Valley is filled with stuff to buy: supplies from Kristoff, gems from Aladdin, seeds from Goofy, and, of course, furniture and clothing from the Valley's greatest money-lover himself, Scrooge McDuck. Keeping up a steady supply of Star Coins isn't easy, especially with so much to buy, so I've developed a consistent strategy for racking up the gold quickly.

This strategy typically earns me several hundred thousand Star Coins over a roughly 2-4 hour period. However, it can only be carried out at certain times of day, because it includes Here and There Fish, which are only available between 6AM–10AM and 6PM–10PM. (They are also only unlocked once you reach Level 10 Friendship with Nala.) I like to start at 6PM, but, if you're more of a morning gamer, that works too. Note that this strategy may not be THE most optimally efficient, but I like it because it lets you rotate between different Village tasks like mining, fishing and gardening rather than doing the same thing for hours on end.

Before you officially begin the steps below, make sure you've done the following:

  • Dug holes for planting seeds in the Forgotten Lands. You can also do your digging later on, but it helps to have a field or two pre-prepared.
  • Cooked some Meals to make sure you don't run out of Stamina. A good Meal that's easy to make lots of is the Souffle, which is made entirely of ingredients bought at Chez Remy (Cheese, Eggs, Milk, and Butter.)

Step 1: Plant Your First Pumpkin Field

If you're a regular Disney Dreamlight Valley player, you've probably guessed that this strategy revolves around pumpkins. They're the Valley's most profitable vegetable, and that hasn't changed in the several years the game's been out. This strategy revolves around letting one field of pumpkins grow at their natural pace, then completing other money-making tasks (including planting more pumpkins) while they grow. Plus, starting with a naturally growing field lets you dig up the Rich Soil you'll need for potion-making later.

Purchase as many pumpkin seeds as you like (I tend to go for the max purchase of 99) at Goofy's Stall in the Forgotten Lands. Then, plant them in their natural biome and water them. No need to use any Elixirs - we're letting this field grow naturally. They take 3 hours and 36 minutes to grow and need watered twice, roughly every 90 minutes, so make sure to set a timer. (Note that you can also replace the first field with Okra, which grows in two hours in the Glade of Trust, if you don't want to wait for Pumpkins.)

Step 2: Mine For Vitalys Crystals

Next, Hang Out with any Villager with the Mining Role (ideally with their Mining Skill leveled up to 10 for maximum bonus drops). Then, eat some tasty food to max your Stamina bar, as that will increase your chance of getting your own bonuses. Finally, head to the Vitalys Mines in the Sunlit Plateau and mine every Mining Spot repeatedly until the timer goes off to water your pumpkins for the first time.

Once you're done, water Pumpkin Patch 1 and sell any Rubies and Sapphires from your mining endeavors. (You can sell Onyxes too if you want, but I prefer to keep them to make Miraculous Pickaxe Polish potions.) This will net you some nice bonus cash, as Rubies and Sapphires sell for 350 Star Coins and their Shiny variants for 1,400.

Step 3: Craft Miracle Growth Elixirs

Head to a Crafting Station and use the Vitalys Crystals you mined to make Miracle Growth Elixirs and Even More Miraculous Growth Elixirs. How many you are able to craft will depend on how lucky you get while mining. You probably got enough Rich Soil to craft the potions while you were digging up your fields, but, if you need a bit more, grab a Villager with the Digging Role and go to town.

Once you've crafted your Elixirs, count up how many you have. This will determine how many Pumpkins you plant. Remember that:

  • Each Miracle Growth Elixir can water 20 crops
  • Each Even More Miraculous Growth Elixir can water 50 crops

Step 4: Plant, Harvest, And Cook More Pumpkins

Head to Goofy's Stall in the Forgotten Lands and purchase as many pumpkin seeds as you have Growth Elixir charges. This may be several hundred, so feel free to save some potions for later and skip that step next time you're money farming. Also, make sure that you're Hanging Out with a Villager with the Gardening Role and that you've again eaten some Meals to maximize your stamina.

Plant, water, and harvest the pumpkins. (If your first field requires another watering during this, DO NOT do that until you have used up all the Elixir.) Because of the Elixirs, you'll be able to harvest them immediately. You should end up with a few hundred pumpkins ready to go. Now, you can simply sell them back to Goofy and earn 664 Star Coins per pumpkin, but that's not the best way to maximize your Star Coin haul.

Instead, use a Slow Cooker (or an Ancient Cooker if you have the A Rift in Time DLC) to convert all of your Pumpkins into meals. There are a couple of different profitable options, depending on what you have available in the way of extra ingredients. They are:

  • Vegetable Platter - Pumpkin x 3 (or Pumpkin x 5 if you have a particularly good haul)
  • Pumpkin Soup - Pumpkin x 2, Ginger, Milk
  • Pumpkin Puffs - Pumpkin, Egg, Cheese

If you want, you can repeat Steps 2-4 a second time if you feel that you have the time and energy for it.

Step 5: Fish, Final Harvest, Final Cooking

Now, with the remaining time you have until your first pumpkin patch is ready to harvest, Hang Out with a Fishing role Villager and fish for Here and There Fish. You can catch Here and There Fish in open water or white ripples in any body of water. Do NOT use any Miracle Fishing Bait, as that only causes rarer fish to appear and we're not after rare fish, just Here and Theres.

Fish until your first pumpkin field is ready to harvest. Then, switch back to Hanging Out with your Gardening friend and grab those Pumpkins from your original field. Finally, combine the Pumpkins and Here and There Fish into Grilled Fish Entrees using 1 Here and There Fish and 1 Pumpkin each. You can do this by hand at a Cooking Station or you can use the Slow Cooker if your previous set of meals are done.

Finally, sell all of your cooked pumpkin and fish meals to Goofy at any of his stall locations. (You can also sell any extra non-Here and There fish you caught and non-Rich Soil items you dug up while preparing your fields, plus the Rubies and Sapphires if you didn't do so earlier) In just under 4 hours, you've now earned several hundred thousand Star Coins, and you're ready to buy whatever Scrooge McDuck has in stock the next day.

item.title: The Beginning (AND END?!) of Ryu Hayabusa
item.description: 2025 appears to be the year of Ninja Gaiden, but that doesn't necessarily seem to mean the year of Ryu Hayabusa. After decades of fronting the long-standing series, the "ultimate ninja" is taking a backseat: first in Ninja Gaiden Ragebound, then later this year in Ninja Gaiden 4. With this potential passing of the torch, we look back at the history of Ninja Gaiden, from humble 8-bit beginnings to the possible end of an era!
